nodes.bodyText:
So basically we are limiting the displayable to UTF-8 validation.
If Enlinkd expects this way, that's fine.
Otherwise I'm good with skipping the test validation for values in order to get the original fix of preventing ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

I could still make it fall back to trying ASCII at least.  Though in this case that's still a single ï character, which also seems wrong -- I suspect these devices have a bug in their "null entry" responses that cause this.
It used to return cf though, so treating it as UTF-8 text seems to keep the same behavior here.
I'm open to either way of doing it, if you have a preference.
